page.title: 01Summary of the area
page.content: {The area is dominated by farms and woodland.Farming comprises fatstock cattle and sheep.Arable crops include wheat,barley potatoes,oilseed rape. Grass is grown for sileage,hay and grazing.Tne land is gently undulating. There are some 8 small farms in the area.The major road is the A445 Ryton -Leamington Spa,with the B4453 Leamington Spa-Princethorpe,and a small part of the Fosse Way-in the S.W..Drainage is generally good with small streams and man-made lakes. Deciduous woodland covers c.20% of the area.Settlement is dominated by the village of Bubbenhall-popn.686(1981 Census)-in the N.E.,with the remainder comprising scattered farmhouses, cottages and modern houses.There is one hotel-The Woodhouse,Princethorpe- which has been converted from an old farm,part dating back to c.1450.
